BMR Calculator

Calculate your Basal Metabolic Rate and daily calorie needs, specifically calibrated for men over 40.

Understanding your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is crucial for your transformation journey, especially for men over 40. Your BMR represents the number of calories your body burns at rest to maintain basic life functions.

Why BMR Matters for Men Over 40

  • Metabolism naturally slows down with age
  • Helps in creating effective weight management strategies
  • Essential for maintaining muscle mass
  • Guides proper nutrition planning

BMR Calculator

Calculate your daily calorie needs based on your age, weight, height, and activity level.

Basic Information

Activity Level

Choose the option that best matches your typical weekly activity level

Base BMR

calories/day

This is the number of calories your body burns at complete rest

Daily Calorie Needs

calories/day

Total daily energy expenditure based on your activity level

Personalized Recommendations

Goal-based Adjustments

Fat Loss

Reduce daily calories by 300-500 to lose 0.5-1 lb per week

Maintenance

Eat at your TDEE to maintain current weight

Muscle Gain

Add 200-300 daily calories for lean muscle growth

How to Use Your BMR Results

Your BMR calculation provides two important numbers:

  • Base BMR: The calories your body burns at complete rest
  • Daily Calorie Needs: Your total daily energy expenditure based on activity level

Tips for Success

  • Use these numbers as a starting point for your nutrition plan
  • Adjust your intake based on your specific goals (muscle gain or fat loss)
  • Remember that BMR can change with age, muscle mass, and activity level
  • Recalculate every few months or when your activity level changes
